title: 2018년 Catt 사건
summary: 미국 New Mexico, NM 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Catt. 판결일: 2018-11-13. 법원: New Mexico Court of Appeals.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: STATE of New Mexico, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Angela CATT, Defendant-Appellant.
**판결일**: 2018-11-13
**법원**: New Mexico Court of Appeals
**관할**: New Mexico, NM

**판사**: Attrep

## 변호인


  Hector H. Balderas, Attorney General, Santa Fe, NM, Charles J. Gutierrez, Assistant Attorney General, Albuquerque, NM, for Appellee.
 , 
  Law Offices of Jennifer J. Wernersbach, PC, Jennifer J. Wernersbach, Albuquerque, NM, for Appellant.
 

## 인용

- 435 P.3d 1255

## 판결문 요약

 1       IN THE COURT OF APPEALS OF THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO

 2 Opinion Number:

 3 Filing Date: November 13, 2018

 4 No. A-1-CA-34839

 5 STATE OF NEW MEXICO,

 6         Plaintiff-Appellee,

 7 v.

 8 ANGELA CATT,

 9         Defendant-Appellant.

10 APPEAL FROM THE DISTRICT COURT OF OTERO COUNTY
11 Mark T. Sánchez, District Judge

12   Hector H. Balderas, Attorney General
13   Santa Fe, NM
14   Charles J. Gutierrez, Assistant Attorney General
15   Albuquerque, NM

16 for Appellee

17 Law Offices of Jennifer J. Wernersbach, PC
18 Jennifer J. Wernersbach
19 Albuquerque, NM

20 for Appellant
                                         OPINION

 1 ATTREP, Judge.

 2   {1}   Defendant Angela Catt was convicted by a jury of racketeering, conspiracy

 3 to commit racketeering, and conspiracy to commit drug trafficking. Defendant

 4 moved the district court to set aside the racketeering convictions 1 and enter

 5 judgments of acquittal on the grounds that the jury had failed to find she

 6 committed the requisite two predicate acts and that there was instructional error.

 7 Defendant additionally argued that retrial would violate her right to be free from

 8 double jeopardy on the ground that sufficient predicate acts were lacking. The

 9 district court vacated Defendant’s racketeering convictions but permitted retrial.

10 Defendant now appeals this order. We hold that instructional error warranted

11 vacating Defendant’s racketeering convictions. Because the State may rely ...
